Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/root.c

1/* mpfr_root -- kth root.
2

9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by

11option) any later version.
12

14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */

23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26 /* The computation of y = x^(1/k) is done as follows, except for large
27 values of k, for which this would be inefficient or yield internal
28 integer overflows:
29
30 Let x = sign * m * 2^(k*e) where m is an integer
31
32 with 2^(k*(n-1)) <= m < 2^(k*n) where n = PREC(y)
33
34 and m = s^k + t where 0 <= t and m < (s+1)^k
35
36 we want that s has n bits i.e. s >= 2^(n-1), or m >= 2^(k*(n-1))
37 i.e. m must have at least k*(n-1)+1 bits
38
39 then, not taking into account the sign, the result will be
40 x^(1/k) = s * 2^e or (s+1) * 2^e according to the rounding mode.
41 */
42
43static int
44mpfr_root_aux (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_srcptr x, unsigned long k,
45 mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode);
46
47int
48mpfr_rootn_ui (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_srcptr x, unsigned long k, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
49{
50 mpz_t m;
51 mpfr_exp_t e, r, sh, f;
52 mpfr_prec_t n, size_m, tmp;
53 int inexact, negative;
54 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
55
56 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
57 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg k=%lu rnd=%d",
58 mpfr_get_prec (x), mpfr_log_prec, x, k, rnd_mode),
59 ("y[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d",
60 mpfr_get_prec (y), mpfr_log_prec, y, inexact));
61
62 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (k <= 1))
63 {
64 if (k == 0)
65 {
66 /* rootn(x,0) is NaN (IEEE 754-2008). */
67 MPFR_SET_NAN (y);
68 MPFR_RET_NAN;
69 }
70 else /* y = x^(1/1) = x */
71 return mpfr_set (y, x, rnd_mode);
72 }
73
74 /* Singular values */
75 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x)))
76 {
77 if (MPFR_IS_NAN (x))
78 {
79 MPFR_SET_NAN (y); /* NaN^(1/k) = NaN */
80 MPFR_RET_NAN;
81 }
82
83 if (MPFR_IS_INF (x)) /* (+Inf)^(1/k) = +Inf
84 (-Inf)^(1/k) = -Inf if k odd
85 (-Inf)^(1/k) = NaN if k even */
86 {
87 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (x) && (k & 1) == 0)
88 {
89 MPFR_SET_NAN (y);
90 MPFR_RET_NAN;
91 }
92 MPFR_SET_INF (y);
93 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (y, x);
94 }
95 else /* x is necessarily 0: (+0)^(1/k) = +0
96 (-0)^(1/k) = -0 */
97 {
98 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_ZERO (x));
99 MPFR_SET_ZERO (y);
100 if (MPFR_IS_POS (x) || (k & 1) == 0)
101 MPFR_SET_POS (y);
102 else
103 MPFR_SET_NEG (y);
104 }
105 MPFR_RET (0);
106 }
107
108 /* Returns NAN for x < 0 and k even */
109 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_NEG (x) && (k & 1) == 0))
110 {
111 MPFR_SET_NAN (y);
112 MPFR_RET_NAN;
113 }
114
115 /* Special case |x| = 1. Note that if x = -1, then k is odd
116 (NaN results have already been filtered), so that y = -1. */
117 if (mpfr_cmpabs (x, __gmpfr_one) == 0)
118 return mpfr_set (y, x, rnd_mode);
119
120 /* General case */
121
122 /* For large k, use exp(log(x)/k). The threshold of 100 seems to be quite
123 good when the precision goes to infinity. */
124 if (k > 100)
125 return mpfr_root_aux (y, x, k, rnd_mode);
126
127 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
128 mpz_init (m);
129
130 e = mpfr_get_z_2exp (m, x); /* x = m * 2^e */
131 if ((negative = MPFR_IS_NEG(x)))
132 mpz_neg (m, m);
133 r = e % (mpfr_exp_t) k;
134 if (r < 0)
135 r += k; /* now r = e (mod k) with 0 <= r < k */
136 MPFR_ASSERTD (0 <= r && r < k);
137 /* x = (m*2^r) * 2^(e-r) where e-r is a multiple of k */
138
139 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2 (size_m, m);
140 /* for rounding to nearest, we want the round bit to be in the root */
141 n = MPFR_PREC (y) + (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN);
142
143 /* we now multiply m by 2^sh so that root(m,k) will give
144 exactly n bits: we want k*(n-1)+1 <= size_m + sh <= k*n
145 i.e. sh = k*f + r with f = max(floor((k*n-size_m-r)/k),0) */
146 if ((mpfr_exp_t) size_m + r >= k * (mpfr_exp_t) n)
147 f = 0; /* we already have too many bits */
148 else
149 f = (k * (mpfr_exp_t) n - (mpfr_exp_t) size_m - r) / k;
150 sh = k * f + r;
151 mpz_mul_2exp (m, m, sh);
152 e = e - sh;
153
154 /* invariant: x = m*2^e, with e divisible by k */
155
156 /* we reuse the variable m to store the kth root, since it is not needed
157 any more: we just need to know if the root is exact */
158 inexact = mpz_root (m, m, k) == 0;
159
160 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2 (tmp, m);
161 sh = tmp - n;
162 if (sh > 0) /* we have to flush to 0 the last sh bits from m */
163 {
164 inexact = inexact || ((mpfr_exp_t) mpz_scan1 (m, 0) < sh);
165 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (m, m, sh);
166 e += k * sh;
167 }
168
169 if (inexact)
170 {
171 if (negative)
172 rnd_mode = MPFR_INVERT_RND (rnd_mode);
173 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDU || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDA
174 || (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && mpz_tstbit (m, 0)))
175 inexact = 1, mpz_add_ui (m, m, 1);
176 else
177 inexact = -1;
178 }
179
180 /* either inexact is not zero, and the conversion is exact, i.e. inexact
181 is not changed; or inexact=0, and inexact is set only when
182 rnd_mode=MPFR_RNDN and bit (n+1) from m is 1 */
183 inexact += mpfr_set_z (y, m, MPFR_RNDN);
184 MPFR_SET_EXP (y, MPFR_GET_EXP (y) + e / (mpfr_exp_t) k);
185
186 if (negative)
187 {
188 MPFR_CHANGE_SIGN (y);
189 inexact = -inexact;
190 }
191
192 mpz_clear (m);
193 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
194 return mpfr_check_range (y, inexact, rnd_mode);
195}
196
197/* Compute y <- x^(1/k) using exp(log(x)/k).
198 Assume all special cases have been eliminated before.
199 In the extended exponent range, overflows/underflows are not possible.
200 Assume x > 0, or x < 0 and k odd.
201 Also assume |x| <> 1 because log(1) = 0, which does not have an exponent
202 and would yield a failure in the error bound computation. A priori, this
203 constraint is quite artificial because if |x| is close enough to 1, then
204 the exponent of log|x| does not need to be used (in the code, err would
205 be 1 in such a domain). So this constraint |x| <> 1 could be avoided in
206 the code. However, this is an exact case easy to detect, so that such a
207 change would be useless. Values very close to 1 are not an issue, since
208 an underflow is not possible before the MPFR_GET_EXP.
209*/
210static int
211mpfr_root_aux (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_srcptr x, unsigned long k, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
212{
213 int inexact, exact_root = 0;
214 mpfr_prec_t w; /* working precision */
215 mpfr_t absx, t;
216 MPFR_GROUP_DECL(group);
217 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
218 MPFR_ZIV_DECL(loop);
219 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
220
221 MPFR_TMP_INIT_ABS (absx, x);
222
223 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
224 w = MPFR_PREC(y) + 10;
225 /* Take some guard bits to prepare for the 'expt' lost bits below.
226 If |x| < 2^k, then log|x| < k, thus taking log2(k) bits should be fine. */
227 if (MPFR_GET_EXP(x) > 0)
228 w += MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2 (MPFR_GET_EXP(x));
229 MPFR_GROUP_INIT_1(group, w, t);
230 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
231 MPFR_ZIV_INIT (loop, w);
232 for (;;)
233 {
234 mpfr_exp_t expt;
235 unsigned int err;
236
237 mpfr_log (t, absx, MPFR_RNDN);
238 /* t = log|x| * (1 + theta) with |theta| <= 2^(-w) */
239 mpfr_div_ui (t, t, k, MPFR_RNDN);
240 /* No possible underflow in mpfr_log and mpfr_div_ui. */
241 expt = MPFR_GET_EXP (t); /* assumes t <> 0 */
242 /* t = log|x|/k * (1 + theta) + eps with |theta| <= 2^(-w)
243 and |eps| <= 1/2 ulp(t), thus the total error is bounded
244 by 1.5 * 2^(expt - w) */
245 mpfr_exp (t, t, MPFR_RNDN);
246 /* t = |x|^(1/k) * exp(tau) * (1 + theta1) with
247 |tau| <= 1.5 * 2^(expt - w) and |theta1| <= 2^(-w).
248 For |tau| <= 0.5 we have |exp(tau)-1| < 4/3*tau, thus
249 for w >= expt + 2 we have:
250 t = |x|^(1/k) * (1 + 2^(expt+2)*theta2) * (1 + theta1) with
251 |theta1|, |theta2| <= 2^(-w).
252 If expt+2 > 0, as long as w >= 1, we have:
253 t = |x|^(1/k) * (1 + 2^(expt+3)*theta3) with |theta3| < 2^(-w).
254 For expt+2 = 0, we have:
255 t = |x|^(1/k) * (1 + 2^2*theta3) with |theta3| < 2^(-w).
256 Finally for expt+2 < 0 we have:
257 t = |x|^(1/k) * (1 + 2*theta3) with |theta3| < 2^(-w).
258 */
259 err = (expt + 2 > 0) ? expt + 3
260 : (expt + 2 == 0) ? 2 : 1;
261 /* now t = |x|^(1/k) * (1 + 2^(err-w)) thus the error is at most
262 2^(EXP(t) - w + err) */
263 if (MPFR_LIKELY (MPFR_CAN_ROUND(t, w - err, MPFR_PREC(y), rnd_mode)))
264 break;
265
266 /* If we fail to round correctly, check for an exact result or a
267 midpoint result with MPFR_RNDN (regarded as hard-to-round in
268 all precisions in order to determine the ternary value). */
269 {
270 mpfr_t z, zk;
271
272 mpfr_init2 (z, MPFR_PREC(y) + (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN));
273 mpfr_init2 (zk, MPFR_PREC(x));
274 mpfr_set (z, t, MPFR_RNDN);
275 inexact = mpfr_pow_ui (zk, z, k, MPFR_RNDN);
276 exact_root = !inexact && mpfr_equal_p (zk, absx);
277 if (exact_root) /* z is the exact root, thus round z directly */
278 inexact = mpfr_set4 (y, z, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (x));
279 mpfr_clear (zk);
280 mpfr_clear (z);
281 if (exact_root)
282 break;
283 }
284
285 MPFR_ZIV_NEXT (loop, w);
286 MPFR_GROUP_REPREC_1(group, w, t);
287 }
288 MPFR_ZIV_FREE (loop);
289
290 if (!exact_root)
291 inexact = mpfr_set4 (y, t, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (x));
292
293 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR(group);
294 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
295 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
296
297 return mpfr_check_range (y, inexact, rnd_mode);
298}
299
300int
301mpfr_root (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_srcptr x, unsigned long k, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
302{
303 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
304 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg k=%lu rnd=%d",
305 mpfr_get_prec (x), mpfr_log_prec, x, k, rnd_mode),
306 ("y[%Pu]=%.*Rg",
307 mpfr_get_prec (y), mpfr_log_prec, y));
308
309 /* Like mpfr_rootn_ui... */
310 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (k <= 1))
311 {
312 if (k == 0)
313 {
314 /* rootn(x,0) is NaN (IEEE 754-2008). */
315 MPFR_SET_NAN (y);
316 MPFR_RET_NAN;
317 }
318 else /* y = x^(1/1) = x */
319 return mpfr_set (y, x, rnd_mode);
320 }
321
322 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_ZERO (x)))
323 {
324 /* The only case that may differ from mpfr_rootn_ui. */
325 MPFR_SET_ZERO (y);
326 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (y, x);
327 MPFR_RET (0);
328 }
329 else
330 return mpfr_rootn_ui (y, x, k, rnd_mode);
331}
332
